Description: Head of terracotta figure of bald man. A male head broken from a figure, apparently completely bald or shaved, with a ribbon (marked by a groove) on the brow, holding two ivy-flowers or fruits; on top of the head an applied object (a Double Crown?) has broken away. The left ear is pierced, and the chin has a dimple. The back is undecorated. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt with a grey core and some white inclusions.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3191)
